capripes: <entryFree id="n6679" type="main" key="ca^pri^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caper</etym>, <sense id="n6679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goat-footed</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of rural deities: Satyri, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 582</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit>, (4), 17, 34.</sense></entryFree>
capronae: <entryFree id="n6680" type="main" key="ca^pro_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căprōnae</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">-nĕae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>caput-pronus</etym>, <sense id="n6680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hair of men and animals hanging down upon the forehead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forelocks</hi> (cf. antiae) (ante- and post-class., and rare): capronae dicuntur comae, quae ante frontem sunt quasi a capite pronae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 22, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 342</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
caprotina: <entryFree id="n6681" type="main" key="Ca_^pro_ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cā^prōtīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Juno at Rome</hi>, in whose honor an annual feast was held on the Nonae Caprotinae, July 17, to commemorate the delivery of Rome from the Gauls by slaves who gave warning from a caprificus or wild fig-tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 18</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Fer. Rom. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caprunculum: <entryFree id="n6682" type="gloss" key="capruncu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capruncŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. capeduncula and capedo</etym>, <sense id="n6682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthen vessel</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
capsa: <entryFree id="n6683" type="main" key="capsa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capio; Fr. caisse; Engl. case</etym>, <sense id="n6683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repository</hi>, <hi rend="ital">box</hi>, esp. for books, <hi rend="ital">bookcase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satchel</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 117</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also for fruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 19, 21, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6684" type="main" key="Capsa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Capsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Africa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the districl of Byzacium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded by vast deserts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundered by Marius in the Jugurthine war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:91" default="NO" valid="yes">91</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6684.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Capsenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Capsa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 3 sq.</bibl>; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Capsĭtāni</orth>.</sense></entryFree>
capsarius: <entryFree id="n6685" type="main" key="capsa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capsārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>capsa</etym>. <sense id="n6685.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave who carried the satchels of boys going to school</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6685.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The maker of satchels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6685.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave who took care of the clothes in baths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:15:3:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 15, 3, § 5</bibl>; Edict. Dom. p. 22.</sense></entryFree>
capsella: <entryFree id="n6686" type="main" key="capsella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capsella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coffer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 6, 8</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
capsenses: <entryFree id="n6687" type="main" key="Capsenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Capsenses</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Capsĭtāni</orth>, v. 2. Capsa, II.</entryFree>
capso: <entryFree id="n6688" type="main" key="capso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capso</orth>, <itype>is, it</itype>, etc., v. 1. capio <sense id="n6688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
capsula: <entryFree id="n6689" type="main" key="capsu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>capsa</etym>, <sense id="n6689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small box</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, Fab. Pictor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 102</bibl>.—Hence, homo de capsulā, <hi rend="ital">one who is excessively neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes barbā et comā nitidi, de capsulā toti,</quote> <trans><tr>quite from the bandbox</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 115, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capsus: <entryFree id="n6690" type="main" key="capsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n6690.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wagon-body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coach-body</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14</bibl>; Fest. s. v. ploxinum, p. 230 Müll.: cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 12, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6690.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An enclosure for animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capta: <entryFree id="n6691" type="main" key="capta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capta</orth>, v. 1. capio <sense id="n6691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
captabilis: <entryFree id="n6692" type="main" key="capta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capto</etym>, <sense id="n6692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can take</hi>: res contrariorum, Boëth. Categ. 1, p. 144.</sense></entryFree>
captatio: <entryFree id="n6693" type="main" key="capta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reaching after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catching at something</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilis vocum similium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenti,</quote> <trans><tr>legacy-hunting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 57, § 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6693.1" n="II" level="1"> In fencing, t. t., <hi rend="ital">a feint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captator: <entryFree id="n6694" type="main" key="capta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who eagerly reaches after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endeavors to obtain</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">strives for something</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n6694.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> only in Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 17.—</sense><sense id="n6694.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae popularis,</quote> <trans><tr>that courts the popular breeze</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 33, 7</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">one who hunts after legacies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a legacy-hunter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:202" default="NO">10, 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captatorius: <entryFree id="n6695" type="main" key="capta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>captator</etym>; in the Lat. of the jurists, <sense id="n6695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to legacy-hunters</hi>: institutiones, <hi rend="ital">the establishing of a person as one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s heir on condition of being also made heir by him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:70" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 5, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:69" default="NO">28, 5, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:30:63" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 30, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
captatrix: <entryFree id="n6696" type="hapax" key="capta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captātrix</orth>, īcis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who strires after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aims at any thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia, captatrix veri similium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. p. 16</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CAPT" /></sense></entryFree>
captensula: <entryFree id="n6697" type="main" key="captensu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captensŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>captio</etym>, <sense id="n6697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fallacious argument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sophism</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captio: <entryFree id="n6698" type="main" key="capti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>capio</etym>. <sense id="n6698.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a catching</hi>: pignoris, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl>: odoris, Lact. Opif. Dei, 10.— </sense><sense id="n6698.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A seizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehension</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ob. Valent. 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6698.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a deceiving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in parvulā re captionis aliquid vererere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidere in captionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium multis captionibus suppositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 33, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6698.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq. in dialectics, <hi rend="ital">a fallacious argument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sophism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes istius generis captiones eodem modo refelluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestigiis quibusdam et captionibus depelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiones discutere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">induere se in captiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in captione haerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:53:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 53, 198</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 197; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6698.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu; cf.: fraudi esse), <hi rend="ital">an injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disadvantage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid captioni mihi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mea captio est, si quidem ejus inopiā minus multa ad me scribis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:3:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:200" default="NO">50, 17, 200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captiose: <entryFree id="n6699" type="main" key="capti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. captiosus <sense id="n6699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
captiosus: <entryFree id="n6700" type="main" key="capti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>captio</etym>. <sense id="n6700.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fallacious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:5:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 5, 8</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6700.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to captio, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Captious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophistical</hi> (most freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">animi fallacibus et captiosis interrogationibus circumscripti atque decepti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 46</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">probabilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">captĭōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">sophisms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cap-tĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">captiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insidiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
captito: <entryFree id="n6701" type="main" key="capti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>capto, capio</etym>, <sense id="n6701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strive eagerly after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch at any thing</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captiuncula: <entryFree id="n6702" type="main" key="captiuncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captiuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>captio</etym>, <sense id="n6702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quirk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sophism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fallacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captiva: <entryFree id="n6703" type="main" key="capti_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. captivus, I. A. 2 b.</entryFree>
captivatio: <entryFree id="n6704" type="main" key="capti_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captīvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>captivo</etym>, <sense id="n6704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subjugation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enslavement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 10, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
captivator: <entryFree id="n6705" type="hapax" key="capti_va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captīvātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that takes captive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 199" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captivitas: <entryFree id="n6706" type="main" key="capti_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>captivus</etym>, <sense id="n6706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the condition of</hi> captivus (post-Aug.; cf. Madvig. Cic. Cornel. Fragm. ap. Orell. V. 2, p. 71). </sense><sense id="n6706.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6706.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings, <hi rend="ital">captivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bondage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3" default="NO">4, 3</bibl>. 3; 4, 5, 12; 11, 3, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 14, 11.—Also of animals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6706.3" n="B" level="2"> Collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi coetu alienigenarum, velut captivitas, inferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6706.4" n="C" level="2"> Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">a taking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—Also in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6706.5" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to capio. II. A. 2. a.) Oculorum, <hi rend="ital">blindness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 36</bibl> Elm.</sense></entryFree>
captivo: <entryFree id="n6707" type="main" key="capti_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captīvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take captive</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 7, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
captivus: <entryFree id="n6708" type="main" key="capti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>captus, capio, II. A. 1.</etym>. <sense id="n6708.0" n="I" level="1"> Of living beings. </sense><sense id="n6708.1" n="A" level="2"> Of men, <hi rend="ital">taken prisoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captive.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6708.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">urbs regi, captiva corpora Romanis cessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix precibus, Neptune, tuis captiva resolvit Corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo captiva servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tecmessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 560</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6708.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cap-tīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a captive in war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a captive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prisoner</hi> (freq. and class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:115 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 115 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:201" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6708.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">captīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis captiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:26" default="NO">8, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 264</bibl>. <cb n="CAPT" /> —</sense><sense id="n6708.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that pertains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belongs to captives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 520</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:96:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 96, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 109 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 109 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6708.6" n="C" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">caught</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 932</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:475" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:705" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocodili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 37 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6708.7" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">captured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plundered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken as booty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken by force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 47, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 53, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 46, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum argentumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 40, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portatur ebur, captiva Corinthus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:184 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 184 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6708.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiva mens,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>by love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
capto: <entryFree id="n6709" type="main" key="capto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n6709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. act.</hi> [capio]. </sense><sense id="n6709.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to strive to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of a thing with zeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to catch at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(syn. aucupor, venor): Tantalus a labris sitiens fugientia captat Flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 432</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 42</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam hianti ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 12</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">imbrem ore hianti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo volucres, harundine pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:36" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 217</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(meretrices) occurrebant amatoribus: Eos captabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo cervicem, modo crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:428" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulis naribus auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 376</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 557</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumas ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras et frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus aëra,</quote> <trans><tr>to catch the breeze</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captata Hesperie,</quote> <trans><tr>watched</tr>, <tr>sought for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 768</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6709.2" n="II" level="1"> Figuratively. </sense><sense id="n6709.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to strive after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desire earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seek to obtain</hi> (syn.: consector, appeto, aucupor; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): sermonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch</tr>, <tr>listen to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum aure admota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">solitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid consili,</quote> <trans><tr>to adopt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensiones alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus,</quote> <trans><tr>to covet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit> (opp. praeterire): <cit><quote lang="la">risus,</quote> <trans><tr>to provoke</tr>, <tr>strive to excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 29, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">favorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57</bibl>: nomen imperatorium, D. Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incerta pro certis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes et inania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis auram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auram incertae famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 44, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 36, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegantiam actoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:184" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporem propositionum ac partitionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solas sententias multas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem contemptu ceterorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:98" default="NO">9, 2, 98</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox non captata, sed velut oblata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 73</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">prendique et prendere captans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laedere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acquirere voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With a clause as object: cum, an marem editura esset variis captaret (i. e. magno studio quaereret) ominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6709.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n6709.5" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to capio, II. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To seek to catch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take one in a crafty manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie in wait for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek to entrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi> (constr. <hi rend="ital">quem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quem cujus rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum quo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">magnum hoc vitium vino'st: Pedes captat primum, luctator dolosu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">captatio: quā viā te captent, eādem ipsos capi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu si me impudicitiae captas, capere non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astutemihi captandum'st cum illoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ad illum qui te captare vult, utrum tacentem irretiat te an loquentem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quiddam quod suā vi nos adliciat ad sese, non emolumento captans aliquo, sed trahens suā dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:52:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 52, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 24, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 25, 12</bibl>: verba (<hi rend="ital">to interpret sophistically;</hi> cf. captio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 4, 19</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: contra est eundum cautim et captandum mihi, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 512, 12</bibl>; p. 512, 50: in colloquiis insidiari <pb n="289" /> <cb n="CAPU" /> et captare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33, 11</bibl> ( = captionibus uti, studere fallere).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6709.6" n="2" level="3"> A standing expression, <hi rend="ital">to practise legacy - hunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hunt for legacies</hi> (aliquem or aliquod): <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta senum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:56 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 56 al.</bibl>; cf. captator and captatorius.— </sense><sense id="n6709.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi captato sermone diuque loquendo ad nomen venere Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 279</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
captor: <entryFree id="n6710" type="hapax" key="captor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>capio</etym>, <sense id="n6710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who catches</hi> (<hi rend="ital">animals</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a hunter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">huntsman</hi>, Poët. Anth. Lat. 5, 162, 8.</sense></entryFree>
captrix: <entryFree id="n6711" type="hapax" key="captrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>captor</etym>, <sense id="n6711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that takes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catches;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">she that despoils</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium captrices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:39:226" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 39, 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
captura: <entryFree id="n6712" type="main" key="captu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n6712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [capio] (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n6712.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catching</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of animals</hi>); <cit><quote lang="la">abstr.: piscium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 19, 35, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium et alitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantherae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 93</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6712.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.). </sense><sense id="n6712.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is taken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinxit venatores cum capturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 40, 56, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6712.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi> (acquired by low or immoral employments), <hi rend="ital">reward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wages</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostitutarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhonesti lucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:8" default="NO">6, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
captus: <entryFree id="n6713" type="main" key="captus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from capio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6714" type="main" key="captus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">captus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>capio</etym>. <sense id="n6714.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A taking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seizing; that which is taken</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grasped</hi> (so post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">flos (ederae) trium digitorum captu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as much as one can grasp with three fingers</tr>, <tr>a pinch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 47, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium vel avium vel missilium,</quote> <trans><tr>a draught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:8:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 8, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 7.—</sense><sense id="n6714.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to capio, II. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">Power of comprehension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi> (this is the usu. class. signif. in the phrase ut est captus alicujus, <hi rend="ital">according to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s capacity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">hic Geta, ut captus est servorum, non malus Neque iners,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit> (ut se habet condicio servorum, Don.); so Afran. ap. Don. ib.: civitas ampla atque florens, ut est captus Germanorum, <hi rend="ital">according to German notions</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">w+s ge kata\ *germanou/s</foreign>, Metaphr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl>: Graeci homines non satis animosi, prudentes, ut est captus hominum, satis, <hi rend="ital">for this people</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s capacity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supra</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pro captu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cod. Th. 6, 4, 21, § 5: SVPRA CAPTVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1120, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6714.2" n="B" level="2"> Of physical power (very rare): iracundissimae ac pro corporis captu pugnacissimae sunt apes, <hi rend="ital">in proportion to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in view of their bodily size</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capua: <entryFree id="n6715" type="main" key="Ca^pu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kapu/h</foreign> [kindred with campus, q. v.], <sense id="n6715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief city of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its riches and luxury</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sta. Maria di Capua</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua ab campo dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 1</bibl>; other fabulous etymologies v. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 145</bibl>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuam Hannibali Cannas fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. Cannae.—</sense><sense id="n6715.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6715.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campanus</orth>, v. under Campania, 2. a.— </sense><sense id="n6715.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căpŭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Capua</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3766</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: Capuenses, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Capua</hi>, Schol. Bobiens. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. p. 249</bibl> Orell.—</sense><sense id="n6715.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Că-pŭānus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">of Capua</hi>, used by some acc. to analogy, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=16, p. 163" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 16, p. 163</bibl> Bip.</sense></entryFree>
capudo: <entryFree id="n6716" type="main" key="ca^pu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. capedo.</entryFree>
capula: <entryFree id="n6717" type="main" key="ca^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpŭla</orth> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> from capis; cf. capedo</etym>, <sense id="n6717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bowl with handles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
capularis: <entryFree id="n6718" type="main" key="ca^pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>capulus</etym>, <sense id="n6718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destined for a bier</hi>: capularem dici voluerunt senem jam morti contiguum; <cit><quote lang="la">sed et reos capulares dicebant, qui capulo digni forent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 563, 11 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver, Lucil. ap. Fulg. l. l.: tam oppido Acherunticus? Tam capularis,</quote> <trans><tr>near the grave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 222</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 64</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
capulator: <entryFree id="n6719" type="main" key="ca^pu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpŭlātor</orth> (contr. CAPLATOR, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3765</bibl>), ōris. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>capulo</etym>, <sense id="n6719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that pours out of one vessel into another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a decanter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capulo: <entryFree id="n6720" type="main" key="ca^pu^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capula</etym>, <sense id="n6720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour off</hi> (<hi rend="ital">oil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 66, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 22</bibl>. <cb n="CAPU" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6721" type="main" key="capu^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">capŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>capulus, IV.</etym>; <sense id="n6721.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">of animals,</quote> <trans><tr>to catch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
capulus: <entryFree id="n6722" type="main" key="ca^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to Gramm. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">că-pŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 5</bibl>) [capio; prop. the holder]. <sense id="n6722.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sarcophagus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sepulchre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tomb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capulum... vocatur et id, quo mortuo efferatur, Paul. l. l.: capulum dicitur quicquid aliquam rem intra se capit: nam sarcophagum, id est sepulchrum, capulum dici veteres volunt, quod corpora capiat... Novius... Prius in capulo quam in curuli sellā. Lucilius Satyrarum libro secundo, quem illi quom vidissent... in capulo hunc non esse, aliumque cubare. Var. Cosmotorque, Propter cunam capulum positum nutrix tradit pollictori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 4, 21</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 222</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(feretrum) Latine capulus dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum funera portant, Dum capulo nondum manus excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:362" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum quoddam conspicamur. Ibi capulos carie et vetustate semitectos, quis inhabitabant pulverei et jam cinerosi mortui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capuli lecti funerei vel rogi in modum arae constructi, Placid. Gloss. tom. III. p. 451.—Hence: ire ad capulum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go to the grave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1174</bibl></cit>; and sarcastically: capuli decus, <hi rend="ital">one who deserves a bier</hi> = capularis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6722.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That by which any thing is seized</hi> or <hi rend="ital">held</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the handle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 506</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the hilt of a sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 553</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 536</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 422</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 491</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108 al.</bibl>; cf.: capulum manubrium gladii vocatur, Paul. l. l. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n6722.2" n="III" level="1"> = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with the addition of coleorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 24, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6722.3" n="IV" level="1"> Capulum, <hi rend="ital">a halter for catching</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fastening cattle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lasso</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 5</bibl>; cf. capulo.</sense></entryFree>
capus: <entryFree id="n6723" type="main" key="ca_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. capo.</entryFree>
caput: <entryFree id="n6724" type="main" key="ca^pu^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căpŭt</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">kăp-căpud</orth>), <itype>ĭtis</itype> (<sense id="n6724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> regularly capite: <cit><quote lang="la">capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 124</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 72</bibl> Huschk., where the MSS., as well as <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> German. Arat. 213</bibl>, vary between the two forms), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. kap-āla; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kef-alh/</foreign>; Goth. haubith; Germ. Haupt</etym>. </sense><sense id="n6724.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The head</hi>, of men and animals: <cit><quote lang="la">oscitat in campis caput a cervice revolsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:462" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 462</bibl></cit> Vahl.: i lictor, conliga manus, caput obnubito, form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' capite cano amas, homo nequissume?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cano capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:83 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 83 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl>, and: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 12</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 17</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">raso capite calvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irraso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amputare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite operto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:34:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 34, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obvoluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit> Klotz: <cit><quote lang="la">caput aperire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscindere cervicibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:87:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 87, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 437</bibl>: attollere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 503</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extollere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become bold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: efferre, <hi rend="ital">to raise one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be eminent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 25 al.</bibl>—Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 76 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6724.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: supra caput esse, <hi rend="ital">to be over one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s head</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be at one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s very doors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to threaten in consequence of nearness</hi> ( = imminere, impendere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 69</bibl>; cf. Kritz ad Sall. l. l.: capita conferre (like our phrase <hi rend="ital">to put heads together</hi>, i. e <hi rend="ital">to confer together in secret</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire praecipitem in lutum, per caputque pedesque,</quote> <trans><tr>over head and ears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec caput nec pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>neither beginning nor end</tr>, <tr>good for nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Cato ap. Liv. Epit. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:139 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 139 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6724.3" n="c" level="4"> Capita aut navia (al. navim), <hi rend="ital">heads</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tails</hi>, a play of the Roman youth in which a piece of money is thrown up, to see whether the figure-side (the head of Janus) or the reverse - side (a ship) will fall uppermost, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. 3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:239" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 239</bibl>; Paul. Nol. Poëm. 38, 73.—</sense><sense id="n6724.4" n="d" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the head</hi>, as the seat of the understanding: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena negotia Per caput saliunt,</quote> <trans><tr>run through the head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 300</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6724.5" n="e" level="4"> Ad Capita bubula, a place in Rome in the tenth region, where Augustus was born, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6724.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <cb n="CAPU" /> of inanimate things. </sense><sense id="n6724.7" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the head</hi>, <hi rend="ital">top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi> (beginning or end): <cit><quote lang="la">ulpici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:34:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 54, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 437</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bulborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:140 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 140 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecoris (or jecinoris, jocinoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 26, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 14, 7</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=244" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 244</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">extorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 795</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 627</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 73, § 189</bibl>: pontis, <hi rend="ital">tēte de pont</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Arat. 2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Arat. 2, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molis,</quote> <trans><tr>the highest point of the mole</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">xysti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 19</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n6724.8" n="b" level="4"> Esp., of rivers, </sense><sense id="n6724.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">source</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi> (<hi rend="ital">head</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">caput aquae illud est, unde aqua nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 20, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:636" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 636</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:729" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 729</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 368</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 18, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:91:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 91, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6724.10" n="(b)" level="5"> (more rare) <hi rend="ital">The mouth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embouchure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 41, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:202" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 202</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6724.11" n="c" level="4"> Also of plants, sometimes <hi rend="ital">the root</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 1</bibl></cit>; 95, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 355</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6724.12" n="d" level="4"> Also, in reference to the vine, <hi rend="ital">vine branches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, also the <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">top</hi> of trees, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 195, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 567</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 370</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6724.13" n="e" level="4"> Of mountains, rocks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 249</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 360</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6724.14" n="f" level="4"> Of a boil that swells out, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to come to a head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 76, § 159</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:125" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 12, 77, § 125</bibl>; cf.: capita deorum appellabantur fasciculi facti ex verbenis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n6724.15" n="II" level="1"> Per meton. (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">person</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">animal</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/ra, kefalh/</foreign>, <foreign />, in the same signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">v.
