carmentalia: <entryFree id="n6817" type="main" key="Carmenta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">-is</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car-mentārĭi</orth>, v. Carmentis.</entryFree>
carmentis: <entryFree id="n6818" type="main" key="Carmentis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 277" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 277</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carmen, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n6818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman goddess of prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acc. to mythologists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mother of Evander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who went with him from Arcadia to Latium</hi> (hence Arcadia dea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:462" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 462</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parrhasia dea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:618" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tegeaea parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tegeaea sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 531</bibl></cit>, and Maenalis nympha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:634" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 634</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">and uttered oracles on the Capitoline Hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:462 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 462 sq.</bibl>; Liv. l. l.; 5, 47, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 277" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:336 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 336 sq.</bibl>, and Serv. ad h. l. —Also represented as two goddesses, Carmentes, and under the especial names Postverta and Prorsa (the backwards and forwards looking goddess), Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 16</bibl>; Serv. ad Verg. l. l.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6818.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car-mentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Carmentis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <trans><tr>a gate at Rome</tr>, <tr>near the temple of Carmentis</tr>, <tr>in the eighth district</tr>, <tr>through which the Fabii marched to the contest so destructive to themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:15" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 47, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 338</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, as ominous, also called Porta Scelerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=334" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 334</bibl></cit>, a; 335 and 284, a Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:201" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 201</bibl>, and Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 2, p. 222.—</sense><sense id="n6818.2" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6818.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Carmentis</hi>, celebrated on the 11th and 15th of January, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 12</bibl>; Kalend. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 382</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6818.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmentārĭi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Carmentis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 336</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carminabundus: <entryFree id="n6819" type="main" key="carmi^na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭnābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. carmino</etym>, <sense id="n6819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">versifying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carminatio: <entryFree id="n6820" type="main" key="carmi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. carmino</etym>, <sense id="n6820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguium,</quote> <trans><tr>with the claws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 23, 27, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carminator: <entryFree id="n6821" type="gloss" key="carmi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carder</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carmino: <entryFree id="n6822" type="main" key="carmi^no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. carmen</etym>, <sense id="n6822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make verses</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">votivum quippiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba Graia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6823" type="main" key="carmi^no2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. carmen</etym>, <sense id="n6823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to card</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carmo: <entryFree id="n6824" type="main" key="Carmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Baetica, now <hi rend="ital">Carmona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 8</bibl> (acc. to Cod. Bamb.); Auct. B. Alex. 57.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Carmonenses</orth>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carna: <entryFree id="n6825" type="main" key="Carna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Cardea</etym>, <sense id="n6825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, previously called Crane, <hi rend="ital">guardian of doorhinges</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">of domestic life</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and the life of man</hi>, Ov F. 6, 101 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnalis: <entryFree id="n6826" type="main" key="carna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnal</hi> (opp. to spiritalis; <cit><quote lang="la">eccl. Lat.): delicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1051</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭa</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">carnal things</hi> (opp. spiritalia), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">carnally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 54</bibl>, n. 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 436</bibl>. <cb n="CARN" /></sense></entryFree>
carnalitas: <entryFree id="n6827" type="main" key="carna_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carnalis</etym>, <sense id="n6827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshli ness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnality</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 186" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Temp. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Temp. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnaliter: <entryFree id="n6828" type="main" key="carna_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. carnalis <sense id="n6828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
carnarius: <entryFree id="n6829" type="main" key="carna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to flesh; subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6829.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6829.2" n="A" level="2"> Carnarius <foreign lang="greek">krewpw/lhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi>, Gloss. Vet.—</sense><sense id="n6829.3" n="B" level="2"> Humorously, <hi rend="ital">one who admires a plump habit of body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lump of flesh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 100, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6829.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">car-nārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n6829.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A frame furnished with hooks to hang up meats over the hearth for smoking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drying</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 400, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">545, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:135:4" default="NO">135, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:136:1" default="NO">136, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6829.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A larder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pantry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:57" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 4, 19, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnatio: <entryFree id="n6830" type="hapax" key="carna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulency</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:113" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnatus: <entryFree id="n6831" type="hapax" key="carna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fleshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corpulent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carneades: <entryFree id="n6832" type="main" key="Carne^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnĕădes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karnea/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n6832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished philosopher of Cyrene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of the Stoic Diogenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the founder of the New Academy in Athens</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 131</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 45, 137</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 38, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO">17, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 14</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6832.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnĕădēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-dīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Carneades</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:71 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 71 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
carneus: <entryFree id="n6833" type="main" key="carne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of flesh</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n6833.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 344" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 344</bibl></cit>: membra, Maximian. Gall. 1, 85.—</sense><sense id="n6833.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">carnal</hi> (opp. spiritalis): <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 370</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carni: <entryFree id="n6834" type="main" key="Carni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Celtic people in Upper Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of Aquileia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending to Cärnthen</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Krain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4040</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">their chief town was</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 1, 2</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <trans><tr>the Carnic Alps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carnicula: <entryFree id="n6835" type="gloss" key="carni^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flesh</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
carnifex: <entryFree id="n6836" type="main" key="carni^fex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfex</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">carnŭfex</orth>, <itype>fĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. caro-facio</etym>, <sense id="n6836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an executioner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hangman</hi>, Plaut Bacch. 4, 4, 37; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1017</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:97:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 97, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:175 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 175 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">this office was considered so disgraceful that he was not permitted to live in the city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">but in the Subura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n6836.1" n="b" level="4"> As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 220</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6836.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tormenter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murderer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 27</bibl> Don.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:23" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 42, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna gloriae carnifex,</quote> <trans><tr>murderer</tr>, <tr>destroyer of fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 39</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">murderous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">killing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnifex avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:84:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 84, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes (sc. podagrici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 48, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:173" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <trans><tr>deadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carnificina: <entryFree id="n6837" type="main" key="carni^fi^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfĭcīna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">carnŭf-</orth>), ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carnifex</etym>. <sense id="n6837.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The office of executioner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hangman; capital punishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnificinam facere = carnificem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus carnificinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6837.1" n="II" level="1"> Per meton., <hi rend="ital">the rack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: dolores atque carnificinas facere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 187, 30</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carnificinam subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ergastulum et carnificinam duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6837.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnis perturbatio miseria est, tum carnificina est aegritudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl> (= crudelitas).</sense></entryFree>
carnifico: <entryFree id="n6838" type="main" key="carni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">carnŭf-</orth>), <itype>ātus, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.) [id.], <sense id="n6838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnifical. (hostes) jacentes,</quote> <trans><tr>to be cut in pieces</tr>, <tr>mangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: vitam cum dolore et insigni cruciatu carnificatus amisit, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carniger: <entryFree id="n6839" type="main" key="carni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro-gero</etym>, <sense id="n6839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing flesh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Eccl. Hist. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
carnis: <entryFree id="n6840" type="main" key="carnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. 2. caro.</entryFree>
carnivorus: <entryFree id="n6841" type="main" key="carni^vo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnĭvŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro-voro</etym>; of animals, <sense id="n6841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feeding on flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnivorous.</hi> <pb n="294" /> <cb n="CARP" /> perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 73, 93, § 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carnosus: <entryFree id="n6842" type="main" key="carno_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleshy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6842.1" n="A" level="2"> Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum aquatilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 43, 98, § 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor carnosus sanguineis venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 144</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 40, § 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6842.2" n="B" level="2"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 24, 38, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misy carnosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 12, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnosissimae olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carnulentus: <entryFree id="n6843" type="main" key="carnu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carnŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like flesh</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tactus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 41</bibl></cit>: pectora, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 372.</sense></entryFree>
carnuntum: <entryFree id="n6844" type="main" key="Carnuntum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnuntum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old Celtic town of Upper Pannonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Danube</hi> (now near <hi rend="ital">Haimburg</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:109:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 109, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2288 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
carnus: <entryFree id="n6845" type="main" key="Carnu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, v. Carni.</entryFree>
carnutes: <entryFree id="n6846" type="main" key="Carnu_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnūtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karnou=toi</foreign>, <sense id="n6846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on both sides of the Liger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief town was Autricum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Chartres</hi>, in the <hi rend="ital">Départ. d</hi>'<hi rend="ital">Eure et Loire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 56</bibl>; 6, 2; 6, 4; 7, 2; 8, 31; ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnōtēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Carnutes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 2 al.</bibl>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carnūtē-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Carnutes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
caro: <entryFree id="n6847" type="main" key="ca_ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kei/rw</foreign>; Germ. scheren; Engl. sheer</etym>, <sense id="n6847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to card</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 46</bibl>; and in Naev. acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 54</bibl> Müll., p. 92 Bip. (cf.: caritores, 2. carmen, 2. carmino, etc.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6848" type="main" key="ca^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căro</orth>, <itype>carnis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> carnis, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 684</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3, 4</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> carni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 6</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. kravya; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kre/as</foreign>; Germ. Kern</etym>, <sense id="n6848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flesh</hi> (animal or vegetable). </sense><sense id="n6848.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">deturbavit totum cum carni carnarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem Latinis petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui carnem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacte et carne vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferina,</quote> <trans><tr>venison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tosta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:156 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 156 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 195</bibl></cit>.—So also freq. in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:327" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 327</bibl> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 769</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 64, § 126</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">The flesh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of fruits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 27, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:205" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 14, 58, § 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 17, 1</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">the inner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">white part of the wood of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">under the alburnum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 72, § 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6848.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of the human <hi rend="ital">body</hi> (in opp. to the spirit), as the seat of the passions: <cit><quote lang="la">animus liber habitat: numquam me caro ista compellet ad metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 22</bibl></cit>.—In contempt: <cit><quote lang="la">caro putida,</quote> <trans><tr>of a stupid person</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6848.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of precious stones, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sarki/on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the soft part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6848.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of discourse, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeschines carnis plus habet, minus lacertorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 77</bibl></cit> Spald. and Frotsch.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6849" type="main" key="ca_ro_3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. carus <sense id="n6849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
caroenum: <entryFree id="n6850" type="main" key="ca^roenum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căroenum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. carenum.</entryFree>
caros: <entryFree id="n6851" type="main" key="ca^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n6851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heavy sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torpor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleep of death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6851.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The seed of the hypericon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carota: <entryFree id="n6852" type="main" key="ca^ro_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cărōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpasum: <entryFree id="n6853" type="main" key="carpa^sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpăsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/rpason</foreign>, <sense id="n6853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with narcotic juice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 17</bibl>; the same, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">carpăthĭum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 20, § 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpathium: <entryFree id="n6854" type="main" key="carpa^thi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpăthĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. carpasum.</entryFree>
carpathius: <entryFree id="n6855" type="main" key="Carpa^thi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpăthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Carpathus.</entryFree>
carpathus: <entryFree id="n6856" type="main" key="Carpa^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpăthus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/rpaqos</foreign>, <sense id="n6856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Crete and Rhodes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Scarpanto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:133" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 36, § 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6856.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpăthĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karpa/qios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Carpathian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea named from Carpathus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 7, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 387</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Proteus</tr>, <tr>who had his abode there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 249</bibl></cit>; cf. Verg. l. l. and Serv.; <cit><quote lang="la">so also senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carpatina: <entryFree id="n6857" type="main" key="carpa^ti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpătĭna</orth>, v. carbatina.</entryFree>
carpentarius: <entryFree id="n6858" type="main" key="carpenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>carpentum</etym>, <sense id="n6858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a wagon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chariot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>: artifex, <cb n="CARP" /> <hi rend="ital">a wagon</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">carriage-maker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 52</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fabri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: vehiculu m = carpentum, Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 29.—</sense><sense id="n6858.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n6858.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">carpentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a carriage-driver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coachman</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 31.— </sense><sense id="n6858.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">carpentārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. fabrica), <hi rend="ital">a wagon</hi>- or <hi rend="ital">carriage - maker</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s workshop</hi>, Firm. 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
carpentum: <entryFree id="n6859" type="main" key="carpentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a two-wheeled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered carriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coach</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">chariot</hi>, esp. used in town and by women, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:619" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 619</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 48, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:147 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 147 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 10; <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.: funebre or pompaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 21, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimbrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6859.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wagon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cart</hi> for agricultural use (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">stercoris,</quote> <trans><tr>a dung-cart</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carpesii: <entryFree id="n6860" type="main" key="Carpe_si^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpēsĭi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpētāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">the south-western neighbors of the Celtiberi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 26, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 5, 11</bibl> and 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Carpetani</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpētānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Carpetani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpheotum: <entryFree id="n6861" type="foreign" key="carphe^o_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carphĕōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excellent kind of white frankincense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 60</bibl> (carfiathum, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
carphologia: <entryFree id="n6862" type="greek" key="carpho^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carphŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karfologi/a</foreign>, of sick persons, <sense id="n6862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a picking of pieces of straw from the</hi> (<hi rend="ital">mud</hi>) <hi rend="ital">walls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 4</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
carphos: <entryFree id="n6863" type="greek" key="carpho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carphŏs</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/rfos</foreign>, <sense id="n6863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant;</hi> in pure Lat. faenum Graecum, <hi rend="ital">goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-thorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fenugreek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 120, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpi: <entryFree id="n6864" type="main" key="Carpi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Danube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Dacia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpinatius: <entryFree id="n6865" type="main" key="Carpina_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpinātĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pro-magister of the Publicani in Sicily under Verres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of the chief agents in his robberies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:71:section=167 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 71, § 167 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
carpineus: <entryFree id="n6866" type="main" key="carpi_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>carpinus</etym> <sense id="n6866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of hornbeam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:92" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carpinus: <entryFree id="n6867" type="main" key="carpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hornbeam</hi> of two species, </sense><sense id="n6867.1" n="I" level="1"> Alba or carpinus alone: Carpinus betulus, Linn.; now <hi rend="ital">carpino bianco</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:12, p. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 12, p. 74</bibl> Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:74" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 18, 30, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6867.2" n="II" level="1"> Atra, now called <hi rend="ital">sappino</hi>: Carpinus ostrya, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 75, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpisculus: <entryFree id="n6868" type="main" key="carpiscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpiscŭlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">carpuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">krhpis</foreign>, crepida</etym>. <sense id="n6868.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of shoes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6868.1" n="II" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">groundwork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">basement</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3272</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpistes: <entryFree id="n6869" type="main" key="carpistes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpistes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">karpisth/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Æons of Valentinus</hi>, i. q. horos, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpo: <entryFree id="n6870" type="main" key="carpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype> <etym>cf.: rapio, <foreign lang="greek">a(rpa/zw, karpos</foreign>; Engl. grab, grip, grasp</etym>. <sense id="n6870.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of plants, flowers, fruits, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pluck off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gather</hi> (class.; in prose and poetry, esp. in the latter very freq.; syn. decerpere). </sense><sense id="n6870.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(flos) tenui carptus ungui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab arbore flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:380" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 380</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, II.: rosam, poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violas et papavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violas, lilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes uncis manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenis pomaria ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemiam de palmite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6870.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6870.3" n="1" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to take something as nourishment</hi> (cf. Burm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 28, 4</bibl>); first, of nourishment from plants, <hi rend="ital">to crop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pluck off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">browse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graze on</hi>, etc. (syn. depascere); also of flesh, <hi rend="ital">to eat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devour</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">alia (animalia) sugunt, alia carpunt, alia vorant, alia mandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpunt gramen equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 353</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 299</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 296</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 927</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:750" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 750</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes carpunt ex oleā arbore ceram, e fico mel, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>gather</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:24 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 24 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">apis carpens thyma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Invidia (personif. envy) summa cacumina carpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec carpsere jecur volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 28, 4</bibl>.—Sometimes transf., of men: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpe cibos digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 755</bibl></cit>: pisces, pulles,<cb n="CARP" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to carve;</hi> hence the pun in <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6870.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of other things, <hi rend="ital">to tear off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summas carpens media inter cornua saetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 245</bibl></cit>.—Of wool, <hi rend="ital">to pluck;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 390</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 6, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana carpta,</quote> <trans><tr>carded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit> (hence, facete: stolidum pecus, <hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fleece rich lovers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 16, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 420</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ex collo furtim coronas,</quote> <trans><tr>to pull off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem genasque,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear</tr>, <tr>rend</tr>, <tr>lacerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so acc. to Servius's inaccurate account, in a fragment of the Twelve Tables: mulier faciem ne carpito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 606</bibl></cit> (instead of the real words: MVLIERES. GENAS. NE. RADVNTO.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Dirks. Fragm. XII. Tab. p. 668): artus in parva frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1061" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1061</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n6870.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6870.6" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. A.) <hi rend="ital">To pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snatch</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omni ex genere orationem aucuper, et omnes undique flosculos carpam atque delibem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 56, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque in legendo carpsi exinde quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: oscula, <hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi>, as it were, <hi rend="ital">from the lips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 117</bibl> Loers. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 358</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:8:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 8, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">basia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:46:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 46, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:151" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni commoda carpe mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:622" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugitivaque gaudia carpe,</quote> <trans><tr>and snatch pleasures as they fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:47:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 47, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 34, 74.—</sense><sense id="n6870.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n6870.8" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to enjoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make use of</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fruor, capio): breve ver et primos carpere flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 85</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flore aetatis frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 4</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">illa mihi sedes, illic mea carpitur aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>spent</tr>, <tr>lived</tr>, <tr>passed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:177" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras vitales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 388</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:712" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 712</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dio somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soporem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes securas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:48" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>; a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> circumlocution for vivere, degere, etc.—</sense><sense id="n6870.9" n="b" level="4"> In a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n6870.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To gnaw at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear</hi> character or reputation, <hi rend="ital">to carp at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calumniate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">more hominum invident, in conviviis rodunt, in circulis vellicant: non illo inimico, sed hoc maledico dente carpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam is carpebatur a Bibulo, Curione, Favonio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulum obtrectatio carpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non desierunt carpere maligni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maligno sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquis orationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnihil vocibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistris sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem in his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ficto quaestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 36</bibl></cit> and 37: <cit><quote lang="la">et detorquere recte facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam vitamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 53, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6870.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To rob of strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfeeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume;</hi> or <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, with the idea extended (cf. absumo), <hi rend="ital">to consume completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si carpere singula (jura) et extorquere... patiemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of in ward care, anxiety, longing, etc.: at regina, gravi jamdudum saucia curā, Volnus alit venis et caeco carpitur igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 490</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 370</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solane perpetua maerens carpere juventā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curā carpitur ista mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegra assiduo mens carpitur aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:305" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:9:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 9, 744</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia carpit et carpitur unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 781</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 5, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego Tot tuos patiar labores carpere lividas Obliviones,</quote> <trans><tr>to wear away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: otia corpus alunt, animus quoque pascitur illis; <cit><quote lang="la">Inmodicus contra carpit utrumque labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:21 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 21 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras etiam templaque demolitur et obscurat oblivio, neglegit carpitque posteritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum potest excedere quod potest carpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:N. Q. 2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> N. Q. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—So, </sense><sense id="n6870.12" n="(g)" level="5"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to inflict injury upon an enemy</hi> (esp. by single, repeated attacks), <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen adversariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes carpere multifariam vires Romanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46:6" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 46, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 61, 13</bibl> infra; Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimum agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema agminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 32, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n6870.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To separate a whole into single parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (syn.: dividere, distribuere): neque semper utendum est perpetuitate, sed saepe carpenda membris minutioribus<pb n="295" /> <cb n="CARR" />  oratio est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multas parvasque partes carpere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam unius belli in multa proelia parvaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 61, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erymanthus... ab accolis rigantibus carpitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is drawn off into canals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:410" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 410</bibl></cit>. —With a reference to the meaning </sense><sense id="n6870.14" n="(a)" level="5"> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">si erunt plures qui ob innocentem condemnandum pecuniam acceperint, tu non animadvertes in omnis, sed carpes ut velis, et paucos ex multis ad ignominiam sortiere?</quote> <trans><tr>distinguish</tr>, <tr>single out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in multorum peccato carpi paucos ad ignominiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6870.15" n="3" level="3"> Viam, iter, etc., or with definite local substantives, terram, mare, litora, etc., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tread upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">navigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail along</hi> or <hi rend="ital">through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way</hi> (syn. ire): <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 629</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 208</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 549</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 709</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremum iter = mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gyrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to go in a circle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:62" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prata fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:604" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus terras, pontum remis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:6:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 752</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 196</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 507: aëra alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:616" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 616</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 311</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpitur acclivis per muta silentia trames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carpophyllos: <entryFree id="n6871" type="greek" key="carpo^phyllo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpŏphyllŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">karpo/s-fu/llon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n6871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub similar to the laurel-tree</hi>, prob. the Ruscus hypophyllum, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> hypoglottion, hypelate, danaë, etc., q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carptim: <entryFree id="n6872" type="main" key="carptim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carptim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>carptus, carpo</etym> (in the ante-Aug. per. very rare; not in Cic.), <sense id="n6872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by detached parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">favos congerere in qualum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas carptim perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carptim divisis agris,</quote> <trans><tr>into small pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carptim breviterque perstringi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:25:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 25, 1</bibl></cit> Schwarz.—</sense><sense id="n6872.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n6872.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">At different places</hi> or <hi rend="ital">points</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on different sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carptim Poeni pugnavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6872.3" n="B" level="2"> Opp. to that which happens at once, <hi rend="ital">at different times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at one time and another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">now and then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad stipendium petendum convenirent Carthaginem, seu carptim partes, seu universi mallent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissi carptim ac singuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (corvi) carptim vocem resorbebunt,</quote> <trans><tr>at intervals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carptor: <entryFree id="n6873" type="hapax" key="carptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>carpo</etym>, <sense id="n6873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carver of food</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 110</bibl>; cf. scissor.</sense></entryFree>
carptura: <entryFree id="n6874" type="hapax" key="carptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>; of bees, <sense id="n6874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gathering from flowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carptus: <entryFree id="n6875" type="main" key="carptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from carpo.</entryFree>
carpus: <entryFree id="n6876" type="main" key="Carpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>carpo</etym>, <sense id="n6876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a carver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui obsonium carpit Carpus vocatur. Itaque quotiescunque dicit Carpe, eodem verbo et vocat et imperat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carpusculus: <entryFree id="n6877" type="main" key="carpuscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carpuscŭlus</orth>, v. carpisculus.</entryFree>
carracutium: <entryFree id="n6878" type="gloss" key="carra^cu_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrăcūtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>carrus</etym>, <sense id="n6878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of two-wheeled carriage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
