carrae: <entryFree id="n6879" type="main" key="Carrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carrae</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carrhae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Mesopotamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Charan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Haran of the Scriptures</hi> (Gen. 11, 31), <hi rend="ital">where Crassus was defeated by the Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carrago: <entryFree id="n6880" type="main" key="carra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carrus</etym>, <sense id="n6880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortification</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barricade made of wagons</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 7, 7</bibl>; Treb. Gall. 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carrinas: <entryFree id="n6881" type="main" key="Carri_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carrīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6881.1" n="I" level="1"> Secundus, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sent under Nero to Achaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and expelled from Rome by Caligula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:204" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 204</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">died by poison</hi>, Schol. Juv. ad loc.— </sense><sense id="n6881.2" n="II" level="1"> T. Carrinas, <hi rend="ital">the name of a bore mentioned by</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carroballista: <entryFree id="n6882" type="main" key="carro^ballista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrŏ-ballista</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-bālista</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>carrus</etym>, <sense id="n6882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ballista mounted on a carriage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carroco: <entryFree id="n6883" type="foreign" key="carro^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrŏco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n6883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a sturgeon</hi>: Acipenser sturio, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carruca: <entryFree id="n6884" type="main" key="carru_ca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrūca</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">carrūcha</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of four-wheeled travelling and state coach</hi> (not before the empire), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11</bibl>, <cb n="CART" /> 49, § 140; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 47, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:62:5" default="NO">3, 62, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:24:2" default="NO">12, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 31 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gall. 3, p. 12 sq.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6885" type="main" key="Carru_ca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carrūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Baetica, <hi rend="ital">north of Munda</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 27, 5.</sense></entryFree>
carrucarius: <entryFree id="n6886" type="main" key="carru_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrūcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. carruca</etym>, <sense id="n6886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the</hi> carruca: <cit><quote lang="la">mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: mulio, Capitol. Max. jun. 4.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">carrūcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a coachman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carrulus: <entryFree id="n6887" type="main" key="carru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>carrus</etym>, <sense id="n6887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wagon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carrus: <entryFree id="n6888" type="main" key="carrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">carrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">carrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Auct. B. Hisp. 6; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 26</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 12, 1</bibl>), <sense id="n6888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of two-wheeled wagon for transporting burdens</hi>, Varr. and Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 26 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; 3, 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 10</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 5, 47.</sense></entryFree>
carseoli: <entryFree id="n6889" type="main" key="Carse^o^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carsĕŏli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karse/oloi</foreign>, <sense id="n6889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Æqui</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, now the village <hi rend="ital">Carsoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 27, 9</bibl>; 10, 29, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:683" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 683</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n6889.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carsĕŏlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Carseoli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:710" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 710</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carsĕŏlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Carseoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.—And in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Carseolano,</quote> <trans><tr>in the region of Carseoli</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 213</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carsulae: <entryFree id="n6890" type="main" key="Carsu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carsŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Umbria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Casigliano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 60</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n6890.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carsŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Carsulœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Carsulano (sc. praedio),</quote> <trans><tr>in an estate near Carsulœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cartallus: <entryFree id="n6891" type="main" key="cartallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cartallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/rtallos</foreign>, <sense id="n6891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carteia: <entryFree id="n6892" type="main" key="Carte_i^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cartēĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karthi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n6892.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient seaport town in</hi> Hispania Baetica, now near <hi rend="ital">Rocadillo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 30, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6892.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n6892.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Car-tēĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Carteian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Carteia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 2, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6892.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cartēĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, the same: legati, Auct. B. Hisp. 36; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6892.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The chief town of the Olcades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis (acc. to others, Cartăla), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 4</bibl>; cf. Alschefski ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
carthaea: <entryFree id="n6893" type="main" key="Carthaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karqai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n6893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the south coast of the Cycladic island Ceos</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Cea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Poles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6893.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthēus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Carthœan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Carthœa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia = Carthaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:368" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 368</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
carthago: <entryFree id="n6894" type="main" key="Cartha_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthāgo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Karth-</orth>, and without asp. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Kartāgo</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype> (<sense id="n6894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">locat.</hi> Carthagini, like Tiburi, ruri, domi, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 7 al.</bibl>; cf. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Gr. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gr. 2</bibl>. p. 236; Zumpt, Gr. § 63, note), <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign /> <foreign /> (prop. new town: istam urbem Carthadam Elissa dixit, quod Phoenicum ore exprimit Civitatem Novam, Sol. c. 40 (27, 10 Bip.); cf. Gesen. Gesch. d. Hebr. Spr. and Schr. pp. 228 and 229; and Robinson, Lexic. s. v. <foreign />). </sense><sense id="n6894.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The city of Carthage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Northern Africa</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*karxhdw/n</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">whose ruins are in the vicinity of Tunis;</hi> also with the app. Magna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 4, 3, § 24</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 683 al.</bibl> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n6894.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthāgĭnĭensis</orth> (upon the Column. Rostr. CARTACINIENSIS), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">COPIAE, Column. Rostr.: res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 2, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a Carthaginian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:230" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 230</bibl> and 234 Vahl.; Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6894.3" n="II" level="1"> Carthago, also with the appel. Nova, <hi rend="ital">a large seaport town founded by the Carthaginians after the first Punic war</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">New Carthage</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cartagena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 42, 2</bibl> and 6 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>.—Hence (cf. I.), </sense><sense id="n6894.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthā-gĭnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to New Carthage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 18</bibl></cit>.—In the form CARTHAGINENSIS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3040</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6895" type="main" key="Cartha_go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthāgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Karth-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of the fourth Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cartheius: <entryFree id="n6896" type="main" key="Carthe_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carthēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Carthaea, II.</entryFree>
cartibulum: <entryFree id="n6897" type="gloss" key="carti^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cartĭbŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-blum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of oblong table of stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing on a pedestal</hi>: a gerendo gertibulum, unde cartibulum<cb n="CARU" />  post dictum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=125" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 125</bibl> Müll. p. 35 sq. Bip.</sense></entryFree>
cartilagineus: <entryFree id="n6898" type="main" key="carti^la_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cartĭlāgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cartilago</etym>, <sense id="n6898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cartilaginous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gristly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:215" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 87, § 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:64" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 23, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cartilaginosus: <entryFree id="n6899" type="main" key="carti^la_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cartĭlāgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of cartilage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very gristly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars, umerus, caput os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 56, § 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cartilago: <entryFree id="n6900" type="main" key="carti^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cartĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. kart, to spin; cf. <foreign lang="greek">ka/rtalos</foreign>, cratis</etym>, <sense id="n6900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cartilage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gristle;</hi> in animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 87, § 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 4, 3, § 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6900.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in plants, <hi rend="ital">a substance harder than pulp but softer than woody fibre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cartismandua: <entryFree id="n6901" type="main" key="Cartismandu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cartismandŭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cartim-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">queen of the Brigantes in Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caruncula: <entryFree id="n6902" type="main" key="ca^runcu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căruncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. caro</etym>, <sense id="n6902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little piece of flesh</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl>, ext. 6.</sense></entryFree>
carus: <entryFree id="n6903" type="main" key="ca_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cārus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">chārus</orth>; in Inscrr. often <orth extent="full" lang="la">kārus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1175</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2417 al.</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. kan, to be beloved; kāru, agreeable</etym>, <sense id="n6903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">esteemed</hi> (<hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, freq. and class. in prose and poetry; syn.: dilectus, amatus, acceptus, gratus; opp. vilis, neglectus, contemptus; carum esse; syn. diligi); <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectionate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 646</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carum ipsum verbum est amoris, ex quo amicitiae nomen est ductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum scio, quam carus sit cordi meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque meo cordi esse quemquam cariorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dis inmortalibus cari simus et ab iis diligamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis carus ipsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta pax cariores Sabinas viris fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo carus atque jucundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 730</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cari sunt parentes, cari liberi, propinqui, familiares: sed omnes omnium caritates patria una complexa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: mater carissima, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 34</bibl>.—So pater, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 707</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 649</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 789</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 486</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thisbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:222" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora, nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:218" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 218</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also pignora, nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 134</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput nepotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frater carissimus atque amantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines mihi carissimi et amicissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quam Ego animo Egregie caram habuerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carum habere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (with amare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 26, 59</bibl> (with diligere): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis suos caros habet, me quidem se ipso cariorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes carissimos habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex decessu carissimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium societatum nulla est carior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina legenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 2, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:750" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 750</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov. uses: <cit><quote lang="la">patria mihi vită meă multo est carior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 20, 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carius oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 82, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:104:2" default="NO" valid="yes">104, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:847 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 847 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cāri</orth> <itype>mei</itype>, <hi rend="ital">my loved ones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:29 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 29 al.</bibl>—In a double sense with II., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:76 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 76 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 29 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est gratum nobisque est carius auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:107:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 107, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n6903.1" n="II" level="1"> Prop. (opp. vilis), <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of a high price</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad macellum, rogito pisces: indicant Caros, agninam caram, caram bubulam, cara omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ei amorem Carissimum... eum confeci sine sumptu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom cara annona sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquos carissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—So annona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl>; (<hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6, 14</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum argentumque caelando carius fecimus (cf. just before: auximus pretia rerum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit>, praef. 2, § 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cariora pretia facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">abl. pretii</hi>: quod non opus est, asse carum est. Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 28</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trecentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 118</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n6903.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cārē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n6903.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a high price</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vēnire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:44:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <pb n="296" /> <cb n="CASA" /> <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6903.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Highly</hi>: carius aestimare, Plancus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6903.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cārō</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">dearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at a high price</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:13:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 13, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6904" type="main" key="Ca_rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cārus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n6904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n6904.1" n="I" level="1"> T. Lucretius Carus, <hi rend="ital">the poet;</hi> v. Lucretius.— </sense><sense id="n6904.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Aurelius Carus, <hi rend="ital">the Roman emperor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6904.3" n="III" level="1"> Another poet, Ov P. 4, 16, 7.</sense></entryFree>
carventanaarx: <entryFree id="n6905" type="main" key="Carventa_na arx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carventāna arx</orth>, <sense id="n6905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the citadel of Carventum near Velitrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 9</bibl>, and 55, 8.</sense></entryFree>
carvilius: <entryFree id="n6906" type="main" key="Carvilius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Carvilius</orth>. <sense id="n6906.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n6906.1" n="1" level="3"> Sp. Carvilius Maximus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> B. C. 293 and 272, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9, 12</bibl>, and 39, 1 sq. al. —</sense><sense id="n6906.2" n="2" level="3"> Sp. Carvilius Ruga, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> B. C. 234, <hi rend="ital">the first person at Rome who divorced his wife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Carvilĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Carvilius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n6906.3" n="3" level="3"> Carvilius Pollis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 11, 13, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 11, 51, § 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6906.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the four kings in Cantium</hi> (Kent), <hi rend="ital">in the time of Julius Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caryae: <entryFree id="n6907" type="main" key="Ca^ry^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căryae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karu/ai</foreign>, <sense id="n6907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Diana Caryatis</hi> (now still <hi rend="ital">Karyes</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 27, 12</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărya</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6907.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n6907.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căryātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Caryœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n6907.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căryā-tis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*karua=tis</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n6907.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Diana</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 8, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6907.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căry-ātĭdes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the maidens of Caryœ serving in the temple of Diana</hi>, a statue of Praxiteles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6907.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">female figures used instead of columns in buildings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caryatides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl> (v. the representation of such a Caryatide from the temple of Pallas Polias, at Athens, in O. Müller, Denkm. d. alt. Kunst, 101, and Dict. of Antiq.).—</sense><sense id="n6907.7" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căryus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Caryœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:225" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caryanda: <entryFree id="n6908" type="main" key="Ca^ry^anda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căryanda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the coast of Caria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karatojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:134" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 31, 36, § 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caryinos: <entryFree id="n6909" type="greek" key="ca^ry^i_^no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căryī^nŏs</orth>, -ŏn, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">karu/i+nos</foreign>, <sense id="n6909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made from nuts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 4, 45, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caryites: <entryFree id="n6910" type="greek" key="ca^ry^i_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căryītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karui(ths</foreign>, <sense id="n6910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> tithymalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 40, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caryon: <entryFree id="n6911" type="greek" key="ca^ry^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căryon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ka/ruon</foreign>, <sense id="n6911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caryota: <entryFree id="n6912" type="greek" key="ca^ry^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căryōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">căryōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 20</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">karuw=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n6912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of nut-shaped date</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 28, 34, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:91" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 29, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:7:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 6 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">these the Romans were accustomed to send on the Saturnalia and New Year's day as a present to their friends and patrons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:27:1" default="NO">13, 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
carystos: <entryFree id="n6913" type="main" key="Ca^rysto^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărystŏs</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">Ka/rustos</foreign>. <sense id="n6913.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient town on the south coast of Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for its marble</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karysto</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Castel Rosso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:14 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 14 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n6913.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n6913.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărystēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Carystos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Carystian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:282" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6913.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cărystĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">LAPIDICINAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2964</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căry-stĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Carystos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 16, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6913.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Liguria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Carosio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caryus: <entryFree id="n6914" type="main" key="Ca^ry^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căryus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Caryae, II. B. 3.</entryFree>
casa: <entryFree id="n6915" type="main" key="ca^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. khad, to cover; cf.: cassis, castrum</etym>, <sense id="n6915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any simple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">poorly-built house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cottage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cabin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1011" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1011</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1254" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 24</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a small country-house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl> Herz.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 10</bibl>.—Of babyhouses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 247</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6915.1" n="b" level="4"> Casae, in late Lat. meton., <hi rend="ital">a country estate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a farm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6915.2" n="B" level="2"> Prov.: ita fugias, ne praeter casam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">do not run so far as to pass the safest hiding-place</hi>, in allusion to a game of hide-and-seek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6915.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">casa Romuli,</quote> <trans><tr>the thatched cottage of Romulus on the Capitoline Hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 654</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:183" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 183</bibl> sqq. <cb n="CASI" /></sense></entryFree>
casabundus: <entryFree id="n6916" type="main" key="ca_sa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsābundus</orth> (in the best MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">cassāb-</orth>, on account of the first long <sense id="n6916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi>, like cassus, caussa, Juppiter, etc.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caso</etym>, <hi rend="ital">ready to fall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tottering</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 53</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21, 16</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
casami: <entryFree id="n6917" type="main" key="casami"><orth extent="full" lang="la">casami</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">casamo</orth>, etc., v. 2. casnar.</entryFree>
casarius: <entryFree id="n6918" type="main" key="ca^sa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căsārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>casa</etym>, <sense id="n6918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a cottage;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n6918.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Că-sārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dweller in a cottage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cottager</hi>, Cod. Th. 9, 42, 7.—</sense><sense id="n6918.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsārĭa</orth>, <itype>quae custodit casam</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=48" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 48</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
casca: <entryFree id="n6919" type="main" key="Casca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Casca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n6919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Servilia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 15, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
casce: <entryFree id="n6920" type="main" key="casce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cascē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. cascus <sense id="n6920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cascellius: <entryFree id="n6921" type="main" key="Cascelli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cascellĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Casell-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n6921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=71, p. 145" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 71, p. 145</bibl> Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">A. Cascellius,</quote> <trans><tr>a distinguished Roman lawyer in the time of Augustus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 45</bibl>; Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 87</bibl>.—Hence, Cascellianum judicium, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 166</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cascus: <entryFree id="n6922" type="main" key="cascus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cascus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. canus</etym>, <sense id="n6922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cascum significat vetus: ejus origo Sabina quae usque radices in Oscam linguam egit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 41, and v. casnar: quam prisci casci populi tenuere Latini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:24" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 24</bibl></cit> Vahl.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 12, 27</bibl>; so Manil. and Papin. ap. Varr. l. l.; <cit><quote lang="la">Att. ib.: sal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 22, 27</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">cascē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">casce nimis et prisce loquens,</quote> <trans><tr>in an old-fashioned manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
casearius: <entryFree id="n6923" type="main" key="ca_se^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>caseus</etym>, <sense id="n6923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to cheese</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheese-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <trans><tr>in which cheese was smoked and kept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 8, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
caseatus: <entryFree id="n6924" type="main" key="ca_se^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n6924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed with cheese</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">polenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <trans><tr>where much cheese was made</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
casellula: <entryFree id="n6925" type="main" key="ca^sellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căsellŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>casa</etym>, <sense id="n6925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hut</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 8, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caseolus: <entryFree id="n6926" type="hapax" key="ca_se^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>caseus</etym>, <sense id="n6926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small cheese</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caseus: <entryFree id="n6927" type="main" key="ca_se^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 3</bibl> and 4; Plaut. and Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 200, 9 sq.</bibl>), <sense id="n6927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cheese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12" default="NO">12, 12</bibl> sq.; Pall Mai, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:240 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 240 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:371 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 371 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere, Varr. l. l.: premere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 72, § 181</bibl></cit>.—As a comic term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">molliculus and dulciculus caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 157</bibl></cit> and 179.</sense></entryFree>
casia: <entryFree id="n6928" type="greek" key="ca^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căsĭa</orth> (rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">cassia</orth>, e. g. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 13, 3</bibl> and 4), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kasi/a</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">kassi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n6928.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tree with an aromatic bark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar to cinnamon</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the wild cinnamon</hi>: Laurus cassia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 85</bibl>, and 12, 19, 43, § 95 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 466</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23, 1</bibl> and 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 93" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:125 al" default="NO">125 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6928.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fragrant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrub-like plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mexereon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> cneoron or thymelaea, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:70" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 12, 41, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 213</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:440" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 440</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:97:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 97, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
casignete: <entryFree id="n6929" type="main" key="ca^signe_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">căsignētē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kasignh/th</foreign>, <sense id="n6929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
casilinum: <entryFree id="n6930" type="main" key="Ca^si^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Vulturnus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the ancient Capua.</hi> In its place stands the present Capua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 17, 8</bibl> sq., and 19, 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6930.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n6930.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭlīnenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Casilinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 171</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6930.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭlīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6930.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Casilinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina, i. e. Casilini portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:426" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 426</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
casina: <entryFree id="n6931" type="main" key="Ca^si^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy of Plautus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from its heroine;</hi> cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61</bibl>. Müll.</sense></entryFree>
casinum: <entryFree id="n6932" type="main" key="Ca^si_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n6932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">east of Aquinium</hi>, now ruins near <hi rend="ital">S. Germano</hi>: its citadel the present <hi rend="ital">Monte Casino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=29, p. 86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 29, p. 86</bibl> Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6932.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n6932.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Casinum</hi>: <cb n="CASS" /> ager, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Casinati or Casinate,</quote> <trans><tr>in the region of Casinum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 227</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6932.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Casinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:527" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 527</bibl></cit> dub. (others, Casini Nymphae).</sense></entryFree>
casito: <entryFree id="n6933" type="hapax" key="ca_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāsĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <sense id="n6933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [cado], <hi rend="ital">to fall repeatedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex tegulā casitaverit stillicidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:20:section=3 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 20, § 3 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
casius: <entryFree id="n6934" type="main" key="Ca^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭus mons</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/sion o)/ros</foreign>. <sense id="n6934.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very high mountain in Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Orontes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jebel-Okrab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 22, 18, § 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 14, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6934.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain between Lower Egypt and Arabia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a temple of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near which Pompey was murdered</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El Kas</hi> or <hi rend="ital">El Katieh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:3" default="NO">3, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 14, § 68</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 539</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Eutr. 54</bibl></cit> Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 14, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
casmena: <entryFree id="n6935" type="main" key="Casme_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Casmēna</orth>, v. Camena.</entryFree>
casmilus: <entryFree id="n6936" type="main" key="casmi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">casmĭlus</orth>, v. 1. camillus.</entryFree>
casnar: <entryFree id="n6937" type="gloss" key="casnar1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">casnar</orth>, in the lang. of the Osci, <sense id="n6937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old man</hi>, Varr. L. L, 7, § 29, p. 86 Bip.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47</bibl> Müll. Here belongs the fragment of Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 20</bibl>: cum more majorum ultro carnales arripiunt, where others prefer the reading casnares; cf. Momms. Unt. Dial. p. 268 (carnales is perh. a euphonic form for casnares, from a Lat. <number>sing.</number> carnal = casnar, as foedesum, plusima, asa, asena = foederum, plurima, etc.; cf. the letter R).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n6938" type="gloss" key="casnar2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">casnar</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl> Gallic, = assectator, <sense id="n6938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attendant</hi> (Meyer, l. l. and Or. Rom. Fragm. p. 530 compares the old French, casnard, flatteur, adulateur; casnarder, aduler, idolatrer. But it is to be remarked that the best MSS. of Quint. l. l. give <orth extent="full" lang="la">casami, casamo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">casamum</orth>, and the like; v. Spald. and Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
caso: <entryFree id="n6939" type="main" key="ca_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cāso</orth>, v. casso.</entryFree>
casperia: <entryFree id="n6940" type="main" key="Caspe^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an old but small town of the Sabines</hi>, now prob. <hi rend="ital">Aspra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 714</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:417" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 417</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
caspium: <entryFree id="n6941" type="main" key="Caspi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspĭum măre</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">to\ Ka/spion pe/lagos</foreign>, <sense id="n6941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:3" default="NO">3, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:10" default="NO">3, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caspius oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caspium aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n6941.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n6941.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cas-pĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Caspian Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Caspian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit> and 4; 3, 5, 3, 4 and 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 25, 29, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a part of Taurus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 13</bibl></cit>.—And as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. mons), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 99</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence pylae or portae,</quote> <trans><tr>narrow passes in the Taurus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 14, 17, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13, 15, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl></cit>.— And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (sc. portae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>the country on the Caspian Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:288" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iaspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans><tr>the inhabitants on the Caspian Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 15, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13, 15, § 40</bibl>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = gens Caspia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 39</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n6941.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same people, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6941.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cas-pĭădae</orth>, ärum, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:106" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6941.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caspĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">porta = Caspia porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cassabundus: <entryFree id="n6942" type="main" key="cassa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cassābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. casabundus.</entryFree>
cassander: <entryFree id="n6943" type="main" key="Cassander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cassander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ka/ssandros</foreign>. <sense id="n6943.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Antipater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and king of Macedonia after the death of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13, 3</bibl>.—After him was named the town Cassandrea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n6943.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek astrologer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cassandra: <entryFree id="n6944" type="main" key="Cassandra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cassandra</orth> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl>; cf. Alexanter; in the most ancient period written in the Etruscan manner, Cassantra), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kassa/ndra</foreign>, <sense id="n6944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Priam and Hecuba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who continually proclaimed the approaching evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was believed by no one. After the destruction of Troy she became the bondmaid of Agamemnon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was murdered with him by Clytœmnestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2</bibl> <pb n="297" /> <cb n="CASS" /> 404; 2, 246 Serv.; 3, 187; 5, 636; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 93" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 93</bibl> and 117.</sense></entryFree>
cassandrea: <entryFree id="n6945" type="main" key="Cassandre_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cassandrēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n6945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon the peninsula Pallene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previously called Potidœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but rebuilt by Cassander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 11, 1</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6945.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n6945.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cassandrenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cassandrea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6945.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cassandreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kassandreu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Cassandrea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the tyrant</hi> Apollodorus, <hi rend="ital">who reigned there</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
casse: <entryFree id="n6946" type="spur" key="casse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cassē</orth>, a false conjectural reading for the MS. cassae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 10</bibl> Drak.; v. Weissenb. ad loc.</entryFree>
casses: <entryFree id="n6947" type="main" key="casses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">casses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (in <sense id="n6947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. acc.</hi> cassem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 28</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> casse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 554</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 885, p. 893" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 885, p. 893</bibl> Bip.), <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a hunting-net</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toil</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">in prose: plaga, retia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:17" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:579 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 579 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n6947.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a spider</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s web</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 202</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n6947.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">snares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casses tendere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 554</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
